div.head: Making Wood Green
div.ab: Take one quart of white vinegar, one ounce of green, and one ounce of rock alum. Mix them together and pour all your ingredients into a leaded pot over fire without taking any air. Then put the pot in manure for 15 days, after which time you shall remove and boil your materials for three hours.

div.head: Making Wood Red
div.ab: Take one quart of old urine, three ounces of madder, and one ounce of rock alum, put all of the ingredients into your pot. Then follow the previously described green technique.

div.head: Making Wood Blue
div.ab: Take one quart of urine, as above, one ounce of alum, and two drams of sal ammoniac, and half an ounce of woad, grind it all to powder. Then follow the previously described green technique.

div.head: For Making Purple Wood
div.ab: Take one quart of urine and one ounce of alum and ten drams of sal ammoniac and one dram of lacquer, then do as previously described.

div.head: For Making Yellow Wood
div.ab: Take urine, as above, and two ounces of woad, one ounce of fustet and two ouncesdrams of sal ammoniac, then do as previously described.
